metadata.Title: CVE-2021-36222 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
ec_verify in kdc/kdc_preauth_ec.c in the Key Distribution Center (KDC) in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) before 1.18.4 and 1.19.x before 1.19.2 allows remote attackers to cause a NULL pointer dereference and daemon crash. This occurs because a return value is not properly managed in a certain situation.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-36222` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

krb5-admin-server - 1.16-2ubuntu0.4
krb5-gss-samples - 1.16-2ubuntu0.4
krb5-k5tls - 1.16-2ubuntu0.4
krb5-kdc - 1.16-2ubuntu0.4
krb5-kdc-ldap - 1.16-2ubuntu0.4
krb5-kpropd - 1.16-2ubuntu0.4
krb5-locales - 1.16-2ubuntu0.4
krb5-multidev - 1.16-2ubuntu0.4
krb5-otp - 1.16-2ubuntu0.4
krb5-pkinit - 1.16-2ubuntu0.4
krb5-user - 1.16-2ubuntu0.4
libgssapi-krb5-2 - 1.16-2ubuntu0.4
libgssrpc4 - 1.16-2ubuntu0.4
libk5crypto3 - 1.16-2ubuntu0.4
libkadm5clnt-mit11 - 1.16-2ubuntu0.4
libkadm5srv-mit11 - 1.16-2ubuntu0.4
libkdb5-9 - 1.16-2ubuntu0.4
libkrad0 - 1.16-2ubuntu0.4
libkrb5-3 - 1.16-2ubuntu0.4
libkrb5support0 - 1.16-2ubuntu0.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: krb5 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.16-2ubuntu0.4').
